alert.note: Alert for Walton; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 11:04PM EDT until March 27 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Choctawhatchee River near Bruce (SR 20) affecting Walton and Washington Counties. For the Choctawhatchee River...including Bruce (SR 20)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Choctawhatchee River near Bruce (SR 20). * WHEN...From late Wednesday night to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Big Cedar, Cowford, and Choctawhatchee River Roads begin to flood in Walton County. Flood waters impact storage areas underneath homes on the west banks of the Choctawhatchee River. Low areas along Strickland Road in Washington County become subject to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 14.6 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.6 feet on 01/27/1963. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
